My designs are

From loading a web page to sending an IM, every action on the web requires energy. If the internet were a country, it will rank #4 in the world for its rate of emissions by 2025. To protect our planetary boundaries, we must design products that are future-friendly, and do not consume excessive resources. Selecting green hosting services, thoughtfully using images and videos, and writing performant code are the most impactful things web developers can do to shift toward a regenerative web and a clean earth for future generations.

Exponential tech is driving an era of extreme change in society, and as stewards of this tech, we can use it to address the existential crises of our time by improving our collective problem solving capacity, and reinforcing the rationality and sense-making ability of democratic societies. For this we must create technologies that are sensitive to human nature, and avoid addictive, manipulative, or exploitative design patterns.

Available to all people, regardless of their hardware, language, location, or abilities. I strive to maintain the inclusive culture of the internet by focusing on, above all, a high quality user experience that adheres to responsive design, internationalization, and W3C standards.

One of the most important requirements for a program is that it be understandable to the people who write and maintain it. In persuit of this, I aim to find straightforward, simple solutions to complex problems, and document them consistently with JSDoc. My comments explain what the code should do, and don't need to be revised when implementation details change.

Scalability is a system's capacity to grow, while extensibility is the ability to add new functionality. Modularity, encapsulation, and following a layered design pattern (like MVC or MVVC) at the application level dictates a clear separation of concerns that allows applications to handle more users and features with grace. These concepts are at the forefront of my approach when designing features of any size.

Projects

SpaceX Launch Tracking

A fun MERN stack project that uses the SpaceX API to show past and scheduled launches, also allows the user to schedule mock launches to exoplanets based on their stellar flux. These launches are populated in MongoDB and manipulated using conventional CRUD actions.

What I learned:

MVC architecture • API testing • Docker / EC2 deployment • Github workflows • REST best practices

Time Blocker

A simple and effective time blocking application made with React. A highly interative application that fully utilizes the React's native state management hook useReducer. The application uses Auth0 authorization and Firebase for user data storage.

What I learned:

React render cycle • JS time and date solutions • Detailed state management • Building highly interative UIs

Chat App

Realtime chat application powered by Socket.io with Node, Express, and PostgreSQL backend. React / Redux frontend. I added many features to this application as a part of an assessment in a team setting, including a message-read status and cookie based JWT authentication. Socket security and efficiency was also improved, as well as a complete redesign of the login / register page.

What I learned:

Socket.IO • JWT • Translating UI prototypes • Redux thunks • Sequelize ORM • Fullstack debugging • Redux devtools

Comfy Sloth

A fully functional React storefront with Stripe payments and Auth0 authentication. Uses useReducer for state management and pulls products from an RESTful API. I converted this project to from useReducer to Redux to explore their differences.

What I learned:

SPA • React routing • Stripe payments • Auth0 • Flux state management

Github User Search

A React app that uses the Github API to search for users and aggregates their data onto Fusion Charts.

What I learned:

Manipulating API data • Data visualization • React context API

Shopify Storefront

A headless React ecommerce site using the Shopify API. Styled with Chakra UI.

What I learned:

Shopify API • Headless architecture • Chakra UI

Small Web Projects

A collection of small-scale, vanilla Javascript web projects.

What I learned:

DOM manipulation • Developer resources • Working with various APIs • JSDoc
